Hi Oliver,

thanks for your response, I=E2=80=99ve posted an issue on githu=
b as requested.

Davy

> On 1 Jan 2015, at 00:25, Oliver Coleman oliver.col=
eman@... [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi Davy,
> 
> A=
re you using the latest version from GitHub? Could you please post an issue=
 at https://github.com/OliverColeman/ahni/issues <https://github.com/Oliver=
Coleman/ahni/issues> including your configuration files and any custom code=
? I haven't used AHNI with a direct encoding very much or recently so it's =
possible there's a bug you're encountering.
> 
> Cheers,
> Oliver
> 
> 
> T=
: 0421 972 953 | E: oliver.coleman@... <mailto:oliver.coleman@gmail.c=
om> | W: http://ojcoleman.com <http://ojcoleman.com/>
> 
> 
> On 27 Decembe=
r 2014 at 02:39, paperboydavy@... <mailto:paperboydavy@...> [ne=
at] <neat@yahoogroups.com <mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com>> wrote:
>  
> 
> Hi=
,
> 
> 
> 
> I was wondering if anyone could give me some advice on using O=
liver Coleman's AHNI library for stanard NEAT experiments.
> 
> 
> 
> The e=
xperiments I am aiming to do would be more suited to a NEAT, rather than Hy=
perNEAT network, however I would like to use Novelty Search and NGSA-II.
> =

> 
> 
> I am currently trying to get the evolution to work by testing on a=
 simple XOR experiment, using the transcriber:
> 
> 
> com.ojcoleman.ahni.t=
ranscriber.NEATTranscriberBain
> 
> 
> 
> I am using the HypeNEATevolver cl=
ass for the evolutionary run.
> 
> In order to get it to work with my fitne=
ss function, I needed to set the fitness in the following three methods, bu=
t as it is a single objective assessment, I am setting the same value for e=
ach:
> 
> 
> 
> chromosome.setFitnessValue(fitness);
> 
> chromosome.setFit=
nessValue(fitness, 0);
> 
> 
> 
> chromosome.setPerformanceValue(fitness);
=
> 
> 
> 
> The evolution does not ever produce a solution, however using ex=
actly the same fitness function in ANJI (without the added fitness assignme=
nts), I always get an optimised result.
> 
> 
> 
> Is there any way to use =
a standard NEAT network within AHNI, while still retaining access to NSGA-I=
I and novelty search?
> 
> 
> 
> any suggestions welcome,
> 
> 
> 
> thanks=

> 
> 
> 
> Davy
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_8B04718F-E3D9-401A-AEA7-20105CA035E6
